intro: Trichocereus candicans subsp. pseudocandicans, commonly known as the "Moon cactus" or "Night Blooming Cereus," is a species of cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and its ability to produce large, white, fragrant flowers at night. The plant is a succulent, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems to survive in arid environments. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for desert gardens. Its nocturnal blooming habit makes it a striking addition to any collection of night-blooming plants.
